title.narrative: Integrated Health, WASH, Nutrition response to the disaster-affected communities in Marka district in Lower Shabelle Region.

description.narrative: The project will provide integrated Health, Nutrition and WASH services to complement ongoing service in Marka by scaling up the services to reach newly liberated areas who haven't had humanitarian services for a long period of time due to the presence of Al Shabab, representing the most marginalized communities of Marka district in Lower Shabelle), through establishment of 2 IERT and supporting the Marka general hospital’s OPD, peadiatric department, maternity department as well as the SC. The project aims to increase the resilience of these populations through enhancing their health, WASH and nutrition status which are the most deteriorated in Lower Shabelle where people are facing massive displacement due to different types of disasters such as prolonged drought and recurring armed conflicts. Therefore, based on the urgent humanitarian intervention on the ground in these areas of Lower Shabelle region and much needed support to scale up and provide integrated health, nutrition and WASH services to most vulnerable and acute watery diarrhea most affected households in the district to have adequate integrated Nutrition, Health and WASH services , through provision of Nutrition supply to support SAM and MAM children and women, Provide vaccination of Measles, Penta1, Penta 2 and Penta 3, Provision of Vit. A supplements, MMN, folic acid, conduct awareness sessions for WCBA, Conduct IYCF awareness sessions, Provision of vaccine to under 5 years children and tetanus toxoid to women of child bearing age (WCBA) in the target areas, Establish and strengthen BEMOC services to pregnant and lactating women in Marka district. Provision of referral for complicated cases including severe dehydration of acute water diarrhoea to Marka hospital, targeting children and PLW, Supporting our health facilities through drugs and different services provided, ensure Women and children access and utilization of basic nutrition services screening and admission of severely acute malnourished children and PLW, as well as ensure access to safe water sources through rehabilitation of 2 shallow wells, chlorination of shallow wells and construction 40 appropriate latrines, carrying out massive hygiene promotion awareness campaigns to reach 32,000 men, women and children including distribution of HP kits to households with malnourished children either at community level or at discharge patient at nutrition or our health facilities in all targeted locations, and finally providing quality training to NWO field staff who are responsible of implementing activities, distribute hygiene kits to communities, and raise capacity of staff through continuous and quality on the job training.
